Detailed Description

A sequence of programs.

Many seismic processing works involves the execution a chain - or a flow - of programs, where each output of one program is the input of the next.

Define Documentation

#define GEOXML_FLOW ( doc   )     ((GeoXmlFlow*)(doc))

Cast flow's document doc to GeoXmlFlow.

#define GEOXML_REVISION ( seq   )     ((GeoXmlRevision*)(seq))

Cast from GeoXmlSequence at seq to GeoXmlRevision.

Typedef Documentation

typedef struct geoxml_flow GeoXmlFlow

The GeoXmlFlow struct contains private data only, and should be accessed using the functions below.

typedef struct geoxml_category GeoXmlCategory

The GeoXmlCategory struct contains private data only, and should be accessed using the functions below.

typedef struct geoxml_revision GeoXmlRevision

The GeoXmlRevision struct contains private data only, and should be accessed using the functions below.

Function Documentation

GeoXmlFlow* geoxml_flow_new (  ) 

Create a new empty flow and return a pointer to it.

Returns NULL if memory couldn't be allocated.

void geoxml_flow_add_flow ( GeoXmlFlow *  flow,
GeoXmlFlow *  flow2 
)

Add all flow2's programs to the end of flow.

The help of each flow2's program is ignored on the copy.

If flow or flow2 is NULL nothing is done.

void geoxml_flow_set_date_last_run ( GeoXmlFlow *  flow,
const gchar *  last_run 
)

Change the flow 's modified date to last_run.

If flow or last_run is NULL nothing is done.

See also:
geoxml_document_get_date_modified

void geoxml_flow_io_set_input ( GeoXmlFlow *  flow,
const gchar *  input 
)

Set the flow input file path to input.

The input file is used to start the flow, by loading it on the first program of flow.

If flow or input is NULL nothing is done.

See also:
geoxml_flow_io_get_input

void geoxml_flow_io_set_output ( GeoXmlFlow *  flow,
const gchar *  output 
)

Set the flow output file path to output.

The output file is the one used to gather the output sent by the last program of flow.

If flow or output is NULL nothing is done.

See also:
geoxml_flow_io_get_output

void geoxml_flow_io_set_error ( GeoXmlFlow *  flow,
const gchar *  error 
)

Set the flow error file path to error.

This should be the file containing the error log, which might include program's stderr

If flow or error is NULL nothing is done.

See also:
geoxml_flow_io_get_error geoxml_program_set_stderr

const gchar* geoxml_flow_get_date_last_run ( GeoXmlFlow *  flow  ) 

Get the flow 's last modification date.

If flow is NULL returns NULL.

int geoxml_flow_get_program ( GeoXmlFlow *  flow,
GeoXmlSequence **  program,
gulong  index 
)

Writes to program the index ieth category that flow belong.

If an error ocurred, the content of program is assigned to NULL.

If flow is NULL nothing is done.

Returns one of: GEOXML_RETV_SUCCESS, GEOXML_RETV_INVALID_INDEX, GEOXML_RETV_NULL_PTR

See also:
geoxml_sequence_move geoxml_sequence_move_up geoxml_sequence_move_down geoxml_sequence_remove

glong geoxml_flow_get_programs_number ( GeoXmlFlow *  flow  ) 

Get the number of programs flow has.

If flow is NULL returns -1.

Writes to category the index ieth category that belongs to flow.

If an error ocurred, the content of category is assigned to NULL.

glong geoxml_flow_get_categories_number ( GeoXmlFlow *  flow  ) 

Get the number of categories that flow has.

If flow is NULL returns -1.

gboolean geoxml_flow_change_to_revision ( GeoXmlFlow *  flow,
GeoXmlRevision *  revision 
)

Change all the flow data to the one stored at revision, except, of course, the list of revisions.

Be aware that all flow data will be lost. If you don't want that, call geoxml_flow_append_revision before.

If flow or revision is NULL nothing is done. If it fails because the revision could not be loaded, returns FALSE. On success, return TRUE.

GeoXmlRevision* geoxml_flow_append_revision ( GeoXmlFlow *  flow,
const gchar *  comment 
)

Creates a new revision with the current time append to the list of revisions An revision is a way to keep the history of the flow changes.

You can then restore one revision with geoxml_flow_change_to_revision

If flow is NULL nothing is done.

int geoxml_flow_get_revision ( GeoXmlFlow *  flow,
GeoXmlSequence **  revision,
gulong  index 
)

Writes to revision the index ieth revision that flow has.

If an error ocurred, the content of revision is assigned to NULL.

If flow is NULL nothing is done.

Returns one of: GEOXML_RETV_SUCCESS, GEOXML_RETV_INVALID_INDEX, GEOXML_RETV_NULL_PTR

See also:
geoxml_sequence_move geoxml_sequence_move_up geoxml_sequence_move_down geoxml_sequence_remove

void geoxml_flow_get_revision_data ( GeoXmlRevision *  revision,
gchar **  flow,
gchar **  date,
gchar **  comment 
)

Get information of revision.

The flow is stored at flow and can be loaded with geoxml_document_load_buffer. receive the date of creation of revision. A NULL value of flow or date or comment mean not set. Any of the string should be freed.

If revision in NULL nothing is done.

glong geoxml_flow_get_revisions_number ( GeoXmlFlow *  flow  ) 

Get the number of revisions flow has.

If flow is NULL returns -1.
